meanings.definition: Not agile; lacking agility or nimbleness.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was unagile as it struggled to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent2: The old turtle was unagile compared to the young rabbits.
meanings.sent3: The unagile sloth tried to race the cheetah but ended up taking a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: Her unagile fingers fumbled with the delicate necklace, causing it to slip from her grasp.
meanings.sent5: The unagile robot moved slowly and awkwardly, bumping into walls along the way.

meanings.definition: Slow or clumsy in movement or action.
meanings.sent1: The unagile snail made its way across the garden at a leisurely pace.
meanings.sent2: The unagile toddler struggled to keep up with the other children on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The unagile penguin slipped on the ice and comically slid into its friends.
meanings.sent4: His unagile decision-making process caused him to miss out on the opportunity of a lifetime.
meanings.sent5: The unagile horse stumbled over the hurdles, much to the amusement of the spectators.
